review: On Curbside Service NOT the food: So I've ordered multiple times and usually there aren't that many issues; however, today I was on hold for about 4-5 minutes just to order. They then tell me that the order will take 10-15 minutes, which is perfectly normal. I then call to say I'm on curbside 27 mins later and the order is still not ready. When I got the food the one entree was hot and everything else was a little cold.

CPK is a dependable place to get a place at the "bar" with yummy pizzas (too small for two, gluttonous for one), full and half salads (I like the BBQ chicken without jicama) w/ seasonal menu changes (potato and fried egg pizza?), free hot fresh bread w/ crispy edge and herbed oil, friendly and attentive service (there's even a door opener), and a hella pour from a good wine selection.   They have a free membership so you can earn points: basically you get back $5 for every $100 you spend (or 5% back).  We got a small plate for signing up (a ho-hum asparagus salad: the white corn guacamole is great), and we took advantage of a $10 off $40 special. On the best night, it can be romantic, especially if you're sitting across the pizza oven which is like a fireplace (and a dinner show- these worker bees feel like a bad Circue di Soleil show and tge relentlessly busy pizza chefs are on point). On a bad night, it can be a Chuck E Cheese, especially if you have a distant, inconsiderate mom ignoring her curly-haired, idiotic butterball screaming at the top of his lungs.

Without a doubt, CPK, is one of my favorite restaurants for a delicious, healthy salad!   In addition to the salads, my favorite CPK soup is the smashed pea and barley.  I do wish that CPK would bring back my all-time favorite soup.  I think it was an asparagus soup--soooo freakin' delicious.  I miss that soup so much!      This CPK location is my favorite because of one server, Amanda Jay.  Amanda is a very friendly, welcoming, easy-going, attentive, and courteous server.  Moreover, it helps that she is a long-time CPK server so she knows the menu inside and out.  I love that Amanda knows the menu and her job so well that she doesn't need to write down my order (or my husband's).   The only ding for me about CPK is the "new look" at all the locations.  I don't like the new seating, the new color combinations, or the "feel". I preferred the original seating as it was more comfortable and looked a lot nicer.  If it weren't for the new look, I'd definitely give CPK five stars.   And, oh, yes, the alcoholic drinks at CPK are the bomb!  I just wish that there were FREE refills (as with water and soft drinks) and that they cost a lot less!

One of my favorite restaurants since forever - CPK has always been my go-to restaurant for special occasions, birthdays, etc. I've always enjoyed the atmosphere here and they have been constantly changing the looks of it for the better each time.  I always order a salad and pizza, and every time they come out tasting on point no matter when I come in. I have been to this location many, many times and every time we have typically had great service. No complaints there. Although, this last time it did take a while for our salad and soup to come out. Not a problem though.  One of the girls brought us waters and accidentally spilt one of them all over the table and a little bit on another person in the party. Again, no worries. We understand that those things happen and it was totally out of her control. We were assured that it would get cleaned up as soon as possible, and it was. Even the manager came over and made sure everything was ok after that. Kudos to this location for always having great customer service and valuing their customers; it is so key to running a successful business.  I will say though, that they have definitely been raising their prices and it has led us to choose other options lately. Not that we don't enjoy coming here, but it's just become a lot more pricey. For the 3 of us, our total came out to over $110 not including tip. That is with the alcoholic beverages of course, but it still seemed pricey for a casual dinner. Nonetheless, we will still be back of course.  Two notes I may add:  We continue to still really like their complimentary bread and oil that's provided (this time we were provided another plate of bread additionally without asking and of course devoured it). We love bread as you can tell.  Secondly, I'm still very disappointed that the California Club sandwich was taken off the menu. It's been gone from the menu for a while, but I really enjoyed it. They have a pizza version of it, but I'm not a fan of it as much. I wish they could bring it back onto their menu.  Again, a very solid restaurant and the location is great if you're driving along PCH or near the beach area. There is a lot to do around here.

My friend and I ate here tonight. We haven't been in awhile. We both ordered salads. They were fresh and delicious. Our server James was friendly and attentive. He was also the bartender. He made great drinks. We will definitely return soon.

I made the mistake of ordering one of their seasonal dishes. The roasted garlic chicken was served to me burnt, with the skin visibly black. Thinking that the problem might just be on the surface, I took several bites, only to discover that yes, the chicken was rubbery and bitter to the point that it was inedible. Sent it back, 30 minutes later came back with a less burned one, but the chicken was still very tough, so I gave up. The manager did remove it off of the bill, which was appreciated, but obviously that menu item is severely flawed and/or poorly executed.
I love the staff and the regulars. My go to place when I don't want to cook.
We had a party of 15 last time and our server Tess killed it. The jambalaya pasta is awesome.  Great food, great service, enough said.

Description:  The one thing that I appreciate about California Pizza Kitchen is that I know that I will get a consistent experience no matter which location that I choose to eat at.  They offer a special twists of flavors on traditional pizza and pastas dishes. Location: Located in the Market Place shopping center it sits on the corner directly behind the Trader Joe's grocery store off of Pacific Coast Highway Décor:  All their restaurants are decorated with light woods and yellows that feature a modern sleek design.    Menu:  The menu has a nice variety of pizza's, sandwiches, pastas, salads, etc.  I particularly enjoy the fresh herbs that help in creating a good dish.  They offer several signature fare that compel you to keep coming back for more such as the Quinoa Arugula Salad, Five Cheese Pizza, and a personal fav is The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza (Yum).  The bread and olive oil dip is good as well.  FYI:  They offer gluten free options as well as vegetarian choices.    Service:  Though nothing extraordinary it is always friendly and attentive.  FYI:  They do not take reservations; it is a first come first serve basis.  I have never had to wait very long for a table. Atmosphere:  The atmosphere is casual mid-level sit down dining experience.  They have take-out services as well Restrooms: Large bathrooms that were well maintained Final Thoughts: What I appreciate about The California Pizza Kitchen is that you can feel confident that you always receive a good experience no matter which location you go to.  The Long Beach location is no exception to this rule.  I personally prefer coming for lunch as the prices are more reasonable and you get pretty much the same selections.  This is a good standard choice for a dining experience at the Market Place in Long Beach.

Order Butter Cream Cake and it was so DRY.  I called store spoke to mgr April to let her know to possible to come back and get another one or refund and she went into defense mode....we don't make them and I have know control over those.  I'm thinking: Are you freakin kidding me, and I purchased it at your restaurant.  WOW I must call corporate office on this one.  The sad thing is she's the manger.  SMH

Red berry sangria never disappoints! So relaxing to have a glass of sangria after a stressful day at work. Our server was excellent! CPK has one of the best BBQ chicken salad (comparable to one at Cheesecake Factory). Always nice to end a meal with a dessert, chocolate soufflé with vanilla ice cream on top. Delicious!

When I first walked in at around 830 on sat night the host within minutes found me a table to sit at. My server haley was absolutely amazing. She was so attentive, welcoming, and personable with how packed the restaurant was. As a server myself I was so impressed by her knowledge of the menu and how she made my experience great. Defiantly coming back especially with this being my first time here!

This place was recently remodeled to complement their new menu. Yes, they are serving other items besides pizza. Sirloin is on their menu and rustic is the look they are now going for. I love coming here, even though I live to 2 other locations that are closer. I did, just noticed last week when I was here, some of the menu items has higher prices.  Dang it!  Other than that, I love that they always open the door for you when you come in and leave. The manager on duty always manage to do some small talk with you.  Oh, the lunch menu now consists of combos with Pizza and soup for $11 or 1/2 Sandwich and soup for $10. My favorite tequila pasta is now a whopping $17 for pretty much 5 bites of bliss. I tried making it at home and failed so that's why I still keep ordering it. :) Best way to beat the system here is when they have the $10 off $40 with your CPK rewards and if you can buy the gift cards through Costco. Otherwise, I cannot seem to afford the new menu anymore just for a simple lunch with the family since it now costs me over $60 with 2 kids and 2 seniors.  Good thing the damage is at a location I love with great service,  thus not as painful on the wallet.

Looking for take out pizza led us to CPK, but we decided to dine in since it wasn't busy and the menu looked so good.   We ordered the Roasted Garlic Pizza- very good, not overly garlicky or oniony and no heavy cream sauces.  Chicken Picata was a generous portion of chicken breast filets in light lemon caper cream sauce with angel hair pasta on the side.  The chicken was tender and lightly tangy. A good, familiar place to go when you are craving pizza.

Came here during my visit to the aquarium of the pacific and left disappointed. Our server Kristy pretty much just left us in the dark the whole time. I felt so unwelcome there, everyone was getting good service except us. She came took our orders and dropped off our stack of plates and just disappeared. Didn't ask to refill our drinks or anything, everything we had to call her for. Saw other servers set up their plates and give them complimentary bread which I didn't know about. So I asked her for some and she said, "oh sorry when I tried to get you some... they ran out." Clearly a lie our plates already came out by then and we didn't get complimentary bread till after our meal. Saw other tables receiving it before us. Wow just wow. If she meant to get it she would of informed us at least before our meals came out.  My first experience and I don't want to come back. The other servers seemed fine maybe they should just fire her. Then we asked to claim a free small meal since I signed up for an awards card, she told us we get a free small plate with our meal for being first timers so we can claim it next time.... Okay... Why didn't you say that before? Then we proceeded to wait and got a small plate 15 minutes after our meal was done. Signed up for a rewards card but didn't bother to claim points because I'm not coming here again.

Excellent food, service in this location was top notch. Restroom visit passed with flying colors too, nothing worse than using a disgusting restroom at a restaurant where you are gonna eat. This place is doing right.

This was my second time at California Pizza Kitchen but I came with my brother which was his first. Adriana was our server and she was kind enough to bring him a complimentary appetizer. I am grateful for such kind staff and love the quality of the food here. If Jasmine and Adriana are reading this, thank you girls so much!!

Came to celebrate my birthday here tonight and was served by Noemi. She was a wonderful server, made us feel very welcome! She offered great options and quick on refills. Also talked to her manager to get me a birthday sundae.!My family and I will be coming back to this location because she delivered a wonderful experience. Thank you, Noemi :)

Out of all the California Pizza Kitchens we have gone this is my favorite one !! The minute you walk through those those you re greeted and made to feel right at home !! We always tend to make it to the bar because we love to watch a good game while we enjoy our food and beers !! The bartenders already know us and they always make us feel so welcomed and always engage I'm conversation with us which makes the meal even better ! The food is always good, pizzas always hot and crispy with fresh ingredients ! Good is always served hot and the wait is never too long even when it is very busy !  The chicken tequila lime fettuchini is very delicious and you can taste every single ingredient  !! I enjoy coming to this place have never had a bad experience !! Always a great environment to enjoy a good meal !!

We went to dinner there on a Friday. It was very busy.  Our server was great, our food was delicious and came out fast.  We got a steak  (perfectly cooked),  full Waldorf chicken salad  (amazing), and kung pao shrimp pasta (delicious).  Our only issue with this restaurant is seating.   Everytime weve gone there we have to ask for a different seat.  The hostess are young so i think its the lack of experience.  On this last visit they attempted to sit us at a tiny table behind the hostess station were there was a large party sharing the seating space.  There was an older man sitting right were i was supposed to squeeze into my seat....i would of had to practically sit on his lap to get to my seat.  We asked to be sat at an open booth a few feet behind us away.  By the picture of our food you can see it would not of fit on that tiny table.

CPK is consistently yummy.  The best part is ordering on-line and pulling up to the take-out area where they bring your food to the car.  A great stop on the way home from work when you are dead tired and don't feel like going to the market.  Employees who bring the food out are always super friendly.

I wish you could give it a no stars so my wife orders pick up service and I get there or call him in a half hour later still haven't showed up so I call him and I guess they forgot that I was out there in another half hour goes by before they give me my food which is Cold never come back here again I would never order takeout again I don't think it even come back to this restaurant to get the net all nonchalant and then tried to like blow me off don't say they're sorry just give me my food and off I go

Thank you for being allergy friendly! My son has multiple food allergies so eating out as a family is a challenge. When I asked the waitress for any allergen info on pizza, she came back with allergen list . Service is great, place is very clean and lots of parking. We will be back often !
Way too loud in here. Especially, if you're sitting next to a table full of Chinese people

We went on a Saturday night around 7:30 after a visit to the nearby pumpkin patch.   We waited around half an hour to be seated, which was to be expected given we had a large party.  Service was extremely slow.   The waitress  was doing the best she could but we noticed multpile patrons meeting with the manager regarding the long wait for food.   Roughly 45 minutes after being seated I spoke to the manager and told him we would be paying for our drinks and leaving.   The food made it out in a couple of minutes.   He offered to comp or deserts as he did the table behind us for the same reason.  We ordered the desserts and he came back to the table and said he wouldn't give everyone a desert, we were to share three.  LAME. We ordered or desserts anyhow, paid, and left.

I received a gift card from work in a raffle I never been to a CPK before but it's free so me and my boyfriend went. The food was good I really enjoyed the garlic chicken pizza that was actually the best I've had and my boyfriend loved the garlic Alfredo pasta w chicken. Our server was Sammie she recommended some dishes because I was indecisive and her choice was on point because I didn't know you could half the pizza w 2 diff flavors. When our order came out there was an error it was not half and half what I order but I would have gladly accepted the error because I was hungry. The manager came out I wish I got his name but he was African American about 35 ish years old (sorry if I'm off) he told me that there was a  mistake and assured me the correct pizza was in the oven and I actually would be getting both. A free pizza who would say no? But the experience was awesome they honestly did not have to do that but I appreciated that and also a worker up front opened the door for us and asked us which door we were leaving through and that he would open it for us. Never would think to go here before but I'm glad I did and I would def come again thanks to the customer service here.  Thanks again Sammie!
I've had better CPK than the food I had at this location. The salad I got was blah and the pizza was only ok. The mushroom flatbread was the best by far and our server was great.

We have been here a few times and service and food are always good. We like the $10 lunch special with an individual pizza and a nice side salad. It's perfect, but not all locations offer it. We recommend the lunch menu if you stop in during the week in the afternoons.

The staff is friendly and attentive. I love their food and atmosphere. The food is always on point.!Depending on where you're seated, You can see the sun set from the windows. Definitely a great location!

Great food and great service! Before we were seated I overheard the hosts talking about possibly overseating the waiter, so I automatically thought we were going to wait even more (came here on veterans day). But nope! Our server James attended us right away and gave us great service despite how busy he was.

Came here for dinner. Got Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccini. It was amazing, super delicious.  The service was amazing. Our waiter, Paul, was great. Fastest service I might have ever had.  Great place. Great atmosphere.

We went for lunch, service was excellent, the food even better. For appetizers we ordered dumplings, and guacamole, both were superb! Then I got the Thai salad, which was very fresh and delicious. Others had a pizza, and the Tequila pasta, both were excellent from what I was told.

Paige and Shiela went above and beyond with customer service! (Thank you for the butter cake recommendation it was amazing! ) We appreciate the experience. They were excellent from beginning to end! You can tell Sheila really enjoys her job and was not just trying to please us, she was going table to table making friends with everyone! Paige was a wonderful waitress, who gave us excellent service, even when something went wrong she handled it so well! Kudos to Erick the host, who opened the door for every customer! This is not something you see at normal chain restaurants. The management is handling this place very well! Thank you!

Can I just say the crew here has made my grandson's birthday experience amazing. Just want to say thank you to the crew here and also my friend Bryan Baker. Thank you so much for being amazing people you are, we had a fabulous dinner and a great dining experience thank you, thank you, thank you.

4 stars would be because the servers are very nice. I loved the Thai salad but I would only give 3 stars to my pasta. It was dry for me and the noodles seemed undercooked. Everything else however was tasty. We had buffalo pizza, spinach and artichoke dip which was so good, chicken fettuccine Alfredo, & Thai salad. The salad and dip was my favorite. Everything is very filling and the waitresses were very sweet and attentive to our large party. The pizza is yummy and you don't feel so guilty if you're health conscious because it is pretty thin and not at all greasy. I would recommend the spinach & artichoke and the Thai salad! Also was great proportions for the salad. The pasta seemed like it needed more & the pizza was as expected

This place is DA BOMB!!! Brian the bartender took AWESOME care of us tonight as we enjoyed a beautiful sunset in front of their open flame brick oven. Highly recommend their new hand shaken agave mojito...Cool, crisp & REFRESHING!!! New soups, vegetable squash & baked potato soup duo was the perfect start to this incredible meal. We split the spinich, asparagus angel hair pasta then kicked it up a couple notches by adding goat cheese & pine nuts. How may you fellow Yelpers finish a din-din like that...TIRAMISU with extra sauce B-A-B-Y!!! Brian - We will most DEFINITELY be back for the new CPK entree on the 17th along with the butter cake just because YOU recommended it. GREAT JOB!!!

The food was great, but the waiters were a little slow to check on you, but the food came out fast. Also there is a typo on the kid's menu that says the edamame is $59 at least I hope that's a typo if not that's a way too high price.

So I finally decided to Yelp this California Pizza Kitchen and let me tell you, I'm not sure what took me so long. I started making this place my Monday night spot and I never leave disappointed. The customer service is spot on every single time. Mary and Brian behind the bar make killer drinks and they make sure you're well taken care of. Any of the servers that you get are great but I sit at the bar mainly to watch the big TVs they have hanging.  The only draw back is that I tend to fall in love with "seasonal" salads and as it states they are only seasonal(gone sooner than later) The Caramelized Peach salad was amazing--gone. My saving grace in that is the manager who always seems to be on duty when I go in. April. Not only is she always checking on customers around the resturant, she assured me that aside from the seasonal peaches, she could have the chefs remake the salad any time which goes way above and beyond in my book. Customer service is what gets people to come back and I'll be back for sure. Probably every Monday.  BY THE WAY do NOT let your sweet tooth go un-satisfied. Whatever you do, ask for April and have her make you "The Dirty Butter". It's CPK's butter cake but it has Caramel AND Chocolate sauce drizzled over it with cookie crumbles and some secret addition that kicks it over the top. Not to mention the ice cream. The picture below is not "The Dirty Butter " but the only thing it's missing is the chocolate sauce. I'm not ready for that yet. You WILL thank yourself.
Meh... use to love them. But now it just seems overpriced and bland. The wine is expensive for what they carry. When in for a salad and glass of wine... ended up paying $34.

Every single time this place in this area has the best workers. Excellent customer service. They always make you so welcome. I live in cypress California and o always rather come to long beach is worth the drive. Thank you!!!!

So I decided to come here on a random night when I was hungry, tired of driving, and just didn't want to go home just yet. Sat at the bar and was severed quickly and with very nice service. Ended up just talking to the bar staff and management team. It was a very nice solo dinner and I am not even finished talking about the food.  I would come here again.

By far the worst experience EVER!! We arrived at about 6:30 and not busy at all. We are seated right away, but no waiter insight for about 20 minutes. The manager finally came only because I called the host to ask who would be serving us, but she also didn't know. Our drinks arrived about 10 minutes later, but still no waiter insight. I called the host over again and the manger arrived to take our order, mind you the table directly across and next to use is being serviced by two different waitresses, but never once looked our way. We waited and waited 40 minutes went by when I flagged the manager down and asked as to why tables that arrived way later than us were already being served?! I mean the arrived a good 45 after us an had had appetizer and dinner served.  I asked for the check because I was just about done by then, but he insisted in having us wait while he check on the food again. Well another 20 minutes go by and we finally get our tasteless half-ass food and still manage to miss my daughters mac&cheese. I was so upset, I lost it and simple walked out! The pizza was cold, the pasta was tasteless and service was beyond insulting!!

Four years later and service still sucks. It's unbelievable how bad service has become the norm. Companies have no one to blame but themselves when going out of business.  I was just here a few minutes ago. I was very hesitant about coming here considering the horrible service from years ago; yes, it's been years since I came to this location. No matter how many times I drove-by, I would never think once about coming here.  I went against my instincts and dined here today. I sat at the counter. The waitress asked what I wanted to drink. I told her water and that I would like to start with the white corn guacamole and chips. That was delivered really fast. More than ten minutes went by and no contact with the server. She talked to the couple to the left...just shooting the shit, then walked away to perform another task. Another server began shooting the shit with the couple, then walked right by and talked to the guy next to me while taking his plate. By now I've had it. I bluntly said "would someone take my order".  The manager guy was very apologetic and took my order. He somewhat became the server from that point-on. By now, I was disgusted both at the unacceptable service and with myself for giving-in, going against my instincts and returning here after many years.  The server was whispering crap to the couple; talking in low key...like telling a secret. Not sure what it was about, but regardless, that is unacceptable behavior, especially in front of other customers.  One big mistake servers and restaurants make quite often is treating their "local/frequent" customers better than what they mistakingly think and label as outside customers. I've read many complaints and reviews about that behavior. I've also witnessed it.  A word of caution, they should be very careful with labeling regular customers because a customer which they never see that suddenly dines in the restaurant, could be one of their biggest customers by ordering everyday through various online delivery services or even messenger services. Furthermore, that person could be ordering under a different name such as the name of his assistant who places the order on behalf of their boss or team, the name of the messenger, etc. The point is that they should treat every single customer as a "normal/frequent" customer. But, as usual, having someone process a thought is nearly impossible nowadays. With other customers, the server was fine, but with me, not so much. The manager provided excellent service, but no service situation should ever have to reach that point. A server should be qualified and capable of doing their job correctly.  I only left $3 for the tip, but seriously regret doing so. This place is officially blacklisted for life. There are many alternatives available. The restaurant industry and CPK type food a monopolistic competition; CPK clearly has no monopoly on the industry.

Nice job this visit. Great service, fairly new menu. Had a great super thin crust roasted artichoke and spinach pizza that was just excellent. Our group got  a SANTA fe bowl and a Bahn Mi Bowl, something healthy and delicious. Really fresh and flavor packed. These guys are doing it right.

Came for a quick bite to eat. It was pretty late, so CPK was closing soon. I was hungry so I order the half BBQ chicken salad and personnel pizza. Waiter was efficient and our order came out pretty quick. My BBQ chicken salad was great and my pizza was good as well. All in all, I was very satisfied with my dining experience..

My lady was having a serious pasta craving and we spotted this CPK after leaving Aaron Brothers. I can't remember the last time I went to CPK, probably been over ten years so I couldn't remember if I liked it or not.  The host Lance greeted us and he was very nice, we had a genuine conversation on the way to the table. Erica, our server and was very attentive the entire meal. I got the BBQ chicken pizza and my girlfriend got the bolognese spaghetti. The bread they bring you before your entree is SO GOOD! I wanted to save a piece to eat  later in the meal, but failed miserably..  I didn't have to ask for a refill on my soda because Erica noticed I was running low and brought me another. This is a restaurant pet peeve of mine, if I run out of my drink during the meal and I have to wait a long time for a refill I'm not a happy camper. BUT, not to worry cause Erica was on it!  We were stuffed, my girlfriend said her spaghetti was excellent and she loved the fresh lemonade, my pizza was also good! Disputed that, we had lots left so Erica swept our plates away and boxed them up for us, thanks for the awesome service! Unfortunately I took a star away because I think it's a tad overpriced, over 50 bucks including tip I feel is a bit too much for spaghetti and a personal pizza..

If the simple things in life make you happy, and want to share that with a friend or someone special. Well, you need to come here [or a location near you] to come try their BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad and Sedona Tortilla Soup. I speak only for myself and my palate.  To me, this was a well balanced dinner meal. If you don't mind me saying, it's very satisfying. The comfort level and sky high and you don't feel beyond stuffed.  The location is nice.  You have movie theater close by.  You can have dinner and go to a movie.  Or you can go walk on the beach, it's also close by too.  Great customer service with a friendly staff.  xo - Cookie

I am not typically a fan of these chain restaurants, but my son's school was having a fund raising event at this CPK, so we came here for dinner. The decor is tasteful, and the service was pretty wonderful too.  Our food arrived in less than five minutes at the perfect temperature, and my wild mushroom strozzapreti was tasty.  The pasta was just chewy enough to make it interesting, and the earthy flavor imbued in the pasta made it worth a while to chew.  The potpourri of fungi was the perfect complement to the pasta.  The sauce had a surprising sweetness to it, which was unexpected but not unwelcome. It was my first visit, and I am sure it won't be my last.
Tonight Service was slow and they sat me right in a/c path and I froze, and my food turned cold right away. So much for hot soup. Not a good night for me here.

Went yesterday to have lunch with my sisters. We arrived shortly after they opened, 11:15, perfect as it was fairly empty. I used the men's room as I usually do prior to eating & noticed it was clean. After being seated we ordered & our lunch arrived some 20 minutes later. We found our food all very good, the Resturant in general very clean, our server attentive enough so my only issue was the air conditioner, it didn't seem to work or the staff didn't put it to a cooler temperature as we requested a few times. By the way, I noticed more then a few customers taking off sweaters, hoodies etc, so it wasn't just us.

This location is shit... everyone and everybody that knows me definitely knows that this is my AUTOMATIC GO TO RESTAURANT! But this location changed it all for me. Strike #1 I ordered the sesame chicken dumplings and when I got them they were cold and looked like a shriveled scrotum / rooster neck. It tasted like they pretty much microwaved it.  Strike #2  I tried to order the pesto penne pasta w/ chicken and they said that they took that off the menu along with the spring rolls Strike #3  I skipped an entree and got dessert... of course I ordered the butter cake. I didn't think it was possible for them to ruin and shit on their signature/popular "everyone's favorite" dessert, but I guess so. The butter cake tasted like they made it 3 days ago and let it sit in the fridge... so you can imagine how shit it was.  I'm shocked because they're in a expensive location, so you'd expect this location to hold some kind of standards... in conclusion you guys bombed my food and shit on my experience. I'll make sure to go to claim jumper instead.

I called at 10:01 and they refused to accept a take out order because they stop at 10:00. Mind you, they are open till 10:30. Not the best customer service. What happen to the customer comes first?  Was craving the pizza so much I came in. Surprisingly they take to go orders but you can't call it in. Really?!  Highlight was Casie. Sweet girl with a great smile and very efficient. She gets 5 stars. Manager overheard me complaining and continued to eat and pretend he couldn't hear me. Step up sit and attempt to make the customer happy.  Waiting...... Waiting....... They forgot to make it. Wow. Killing it. Needless to say the manager is still ignoring the situation.

The restaurant closes at 10:30p on Fridays. I went at 10pm and there was no one there. The service was fast, pretty good and appreciated.  I ordered a half of a house salad with Ranch dressing and a cheese pizza. Both tasted really good !! My waitress was on point. She was refilling my water and being real attentive.  Don't you hate when they always come by asking you if you need something when your mouth is full ??LOL I would recommend this location.

I came here on Sunday, October 22nd with my mom and son. I've been to CPK several times before and never had a problem. But unfortunately, this is the second time my mom's plate was just WRONG. She ordered the tequila lime pasta, with chicken which is $3 more. Fine, no problem. Our food came and she started moving her pasta around and actually separated the chicken and no lie, there were like 5 tiny pieces of chicken in her plate. And we are paying for this?! We called over our server who was Paige who was actually really nice, helpful and understanding. She told the chef to cook more chicken for my mom's plate but by this time we were just in complete shock. I know it's a restaurant but isn't there like a certain amount they normally put? When they brought the plate, the manager (female with dice tattoo on arm, can't remember name) brought it over and told us that they can put more chicken we just have to ask for extra chicken. Yeah, but I'm sure they charge another $3 right??? I asked what the amount of chicken they put and she told me "We are supposed to put 2.5 ounces of chicken. I don't agree with the amount, but that's protocol." I'm not asking for a whole chicken on my plate but if I'm asking for chicken on my pasta I want a decent amount of chicken on my plate, especially if I'm paying for like $15++ for my plate. Our server was nice and helpful so that's why I'm not giving 1 Star. I think they need to stop being so stingy with their food.
My favorite location the manager Eva is always so involved and our sever Samantha was amazing!!! The food is always hot and fresh here!!!! Thanks for the wonderful experience!
Always freezing cold in the one on 2nd and PCH. Food is excellent and service is great. If you want to freeze go to this restaurant. Nippy and the a/c blows until you are chilled to the bone.
Food is good as usual. Its a smallrr version of BJs Restaurant, minus the long wait and crowd. Fast casual dining.

The Long Beach Marketplace is well-known for its shopping opportunities. However after making several purchases, you'll eventually need to catch lunch or dinner before you leave. Therefore, my coworkers suggested that we meet for lunch at California Pizza Kitchen.  CPK is located on the corner of Pacific Coast Highway and 2nd Street in the city of Long Beach. It is in the northeast corner of the lot, facing PCH. Ample parking is available throughout the shopping center but if it's packed, you can always park across the street. My coworkers arrived before me so they were already seated at a table. As I looked around, I noticed that most tables had bench seats just like their booths. That makes sense to me because I look at it from a safety perspective. People tend to trip over chairs and I like that CPK took that into consideration when working on the layout and decor of their restaurant. When you think of CPK, most people probably associate pizza with this restaurant. However, their menu has a lot more available to people who might want something different. They have a variety of salads as well as fish selections like halibut and salmon. If you're not in the mood for pizza, you could order pasta as an alternative. I was feeling very hungry so I chose the pesto cream penne pasta. I omitted the tomatoes but added shrimp. While we waited for our food to arrive, our server brought us some bread with an herb-olive oil dip. There were four of us in our party but there were only 5 pieces of bread. I thought that was a bit odd since it didn't seem to be enough for anyone who may have wanted to eat a couple of slices of bread.  Soon after, our meals arrived and then our server brought out another plate of bread. I guess she realized the error and caught it before we could say anything. She was really on top of things. Yay!!! The serving size was perfect for lunch as it was enough to fill me up without making me feel like I overindulged in a heavy meal. The pesto sauce was light and had a creamy blend with great flavor. The shrimp was grilled and the meat was nice and firm with each bite. The tails were still on each one so I removed them prior to eating my pasta. My coworkers really enjoyed their meals too as all but one finished what they ordered. My friend took the rest home to finish for dinner later that evening. I really liked CPK as it's a healthier alternative to some of the other pizza places. The health conscious individuals will be able to find something specific to their dietary needs. Gluten free options are also available upon request. CPK is ideal for a quick meal with a small group of people. Larger parties might find this place to be a bit limited when it comes to accommodations. I'm very happy that I finally had a chance to dine at California Pizza Kitchen because the food was delicious. I recommend CPK to anyone who wants a quick, filling meal at a decent price. Service is great, the restaurant is clean, and their menu is diverse enough for people that want to explore many options.

Haven't been here awhile and now I reminded why we don't come here.  After being seated, we waited 9 minutes for a server to come to our table.  We ordered drinks which took 11 minutes to come back to our table.  A glass of relatively cheap Cabernet was $12.98 which is more than the entire bottle costs at rite aid.  Waited another 39 minutes for our salads which were good but over priced.   Waited again for someone to clear our plates and bring the check.  Not sure if it's just this location that has poor service but I think we'll be sticking to the mom and pop restaurants in the future.
This place is fantastic, nice potion size for the money.  Will definitely return very soon will tell friends also.  Paige was a fantastic waitress the manager came and also made sure we were ok

Very satisfied with today's visit :-) I've been eating at CPK for years. The first location I went to was in Brentwood, 15 or so years ago. CPK's menu gets tweaked occasionally, and they've had some nice new, non pizza, additions to the menu as of late.  Facilities: well kept, comfortable, clean and well lit. Service: Great! Our server, Michelle, was very friendly, informative and as fast as she could be. The only thing keeping it from being perfect is that our area was understaffed so she couldn't get to everyone quite as quickly as she wanted to. Drinks: had water and coffee. The coffee was nice and strong. First cup was not very hot, the next was from a fresh, hot pot. The cream is served in dinky little thimbles though, so you should ask for a few extra. Food: Very good! Had their chili relleno and that was very tasty, especially considering that this is a gringo restaurant :-D Their salad with caramelized peaches was excellent! Very delicious, especially with the grilled chicken added for some substantive protein content. We had the dressing in the side and had no need to use it because it had such a delicious flavor without it. Dessert: Had the new caramel salted pudding dessert, it was very good but could've used less salt :-P

Oh Robin. Robin. Robin. Robin. Thank You for listening to my Dad's tales of Italy. You're a good person for it. :) My family just got back from six weeks spent in Italy and so they were sharing the differences in how Italians eat and how certain food/drinks are "better" there. I enjoyed their stories, but then it moved to our waitress. I don't know if she felt trapped or not. I kept eating my pizza and drinking my Newcastle. Speaking of pizza...  I once again had the White Pizza on Honey Wheat with Applewood Smoked Bacon. The first time I had it was via take out at the CPK on Pine. (Which I've already reviewed). I don't normally order white pizzas as I am a meat eater. Be it sausage, pepperoni, chicken, etc. But I got the bacon to help satisfy my meat cravings. It was just as good as the last time, but it was missing the hot sauce that I love to pour on my pizza... well everything really.  I also had some of their new Crispy Artichoke Hearts. Which were okay. I don't see myself ever ordering them again. I can make better friend artichoke hearts at home. I mean I have all the ingredients (panko bread crumbs, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese) in my kitchen right now. Hmmmm... I think I'll to make them now. This my third or fourth time eating at this particular location and I've had good service each time. Never had to wait long for my food. The food for the most part is good. I'll be back whenever I get a white pizza craving, the rest of the time I'll stick to cheap greasy delivery.

Probably one of the wrost resturants ive ever been too. Me and my team had made reservations so that we can have our team dinner. We got there and it took us forever atleast a half hour to get our drinks alone and then when dinner came they didnt even be spefic on who it went to. Ex: Kids spagetti. Instead they just said spagetti. Like really how am i suppse to know it was for a kid. After that our appatizers came after our dinner like last time i checked appatizers came before the dinner. Lastly they were stingy on howuch sauce they used it was ridiculous , and whenever we wpuld call the manaher over to talk to her about our probalems she would just walk away. NEVER EAT A CALIFORNIA PIZZA KICHTEN ITS THE WORST PIZZA PASTA SALAD PLACE EVER !

was in a hurry and totally desperate for food and stopped in here to this location in Long Beach.  Best Tortilla Soup, hot, fresh and delish, also got the bbq chix salad minus the bbq sauce and was 10 times better without.  great service and quick.  this location is better than others.

I love California Pizza Kitchen. I've only had one bad experience here but that turned out to just not be my day at all. The CHICKEN PICATTA is amazing. It is pretty much the only thing I order, even though almost everything here is super delicious. The servers are friendly and the food comes out pretty quickly. Although why they only have Pepsi and not Coke still baffles me.
The pizza at CPK is ok.  There are plenty of other places that serve a great pizza.  The service is slow here although the staff is friendly.  Solid three stars.

At CPK on Pine the Halibut was divine. Succulent. Adorned with sufficient delicious sauce and properly trimmed and cooked asparagus, it rivaled famous eateries in SFO and LA.  So, tonight we tried to duplicate the experience, but at home. We ordered the halibut for pick up from The Marketplace, LB, and ... we returned it. It was inedible:  the fish was entirely over cooked, the asparagus was less then pencil thin, untrimmed and black from overcooking. The sauce must have been put on someone else's plate 'cause there was none here. Odd thing was when we returned this travesty, they did not care. There was no offer for a new meal, just a refund. Guess we were at Target instead of CPK Too sad but we will go to the Pine Avenue LB store from now on  So, who will scold the manager and staff at The Marketplace store?? Stephen Clemmer

I usually like my dosage of CPK but this location is a bit different.  As far as the food goes. I love the avocado club egg rolls, the thai crunch salad, and the thin crusted pizzas they have. I do enjoy the selection of options and also cpk's new smaller dishes that let you try more without committing to a huge plate of it. I personally enjoy CPK but I would probably advise you to go to a different location.  For some reason each time I go, the service just makes me feel like I suddenly am disappearing into the booth cushion and no longer exist. The first few times, the hostesses really just didn't pay any attention and each and every time I go (because it's close) my server always tells me some excuse about why my food isn't ready yet.  Note to all servers: all I'm thinking about is why my food is running late. Why are you telling me a story about why it's running late and not checking on it right now? I don't mind a heads up that it will be out soon. Don't tell me so and so got it confused and so and so had to figure out how to fix....i don't really care sweetheart. I'm not your mom and won't put you on time out. However I will give you 2 gold sticker stars for your charts.

I've been to many CPK restaurants, but this one was by far the worst place ever. I went here with few of my friends to grab dinner around 5pm. It should be obvious that every customer that walks in to a restaurant is there to eat inside, not ordering a food as to-go. After ordering our dishes, the waitress says it would take longer than usual (only 2 of us ordered a simple sandwich) and asks if we wanted it in a box. Now, why in the world should be order food as a to-go in a restaurant when 4 of us walks in and sits down at a table?  Our dishes come out an hour later, portion was small, and we left with a hungry stomach.  I strongly do not recommend this place if you plan on going to CPK. Only reason why I have this place a 2 star was because the waitress was kind.
Food a good. The server, Samantha, was pretty attentive even though it was a Friday night. Will definitely be back.

After a really great -- but long week --  my hubby Steve and I retreated into this amazing CPK (great location,  staff + test kitchen and managed by a wonderful guy named Pat) for a little Friday afternoon treat!    Head Chef Juan came over and greated us; love that!.   So I asked "what shall I have"?    He asked me if I like fish?   And  when  i said yes, he offered up a little chef's special for me of "cedar plank salmon with picatta pasta".    It was DIVINE!!!     One of the best flavor combos I've ever experienced!    I hope they make it permanent.  :))

Holy cow this place has bad reviews!! I normally go to the Bella Terra location but since Claim Jumpers here in LB was closed for 4th of July my wife and I ended up here at this CPK. Service was friendly and the food quality seemed the same to me as the other location.  My wife had a cup of tortilla soup and the crab cake appetizer. She said both were very good and was full from it. I personally thought both items looked terribly small, but since she's had lap band surgery it was perfect size for her.  I had the Buffalo Chicken Pizza. I loooove wing sauce and was happy to taste wing sauce in every bite. The pizza had wing marinated chicken, carrots, celery, and blue cheese. Very tasty and I enjoyed thoroughly.  In summary, I really enjoyed my lunch and so did my wife. Only negatives on this visit is the prices have definitely gone up and we didn't get any bread that every other table got.... We both agreed we didn't need the extra calories but they could of at least asked. The calorie count printed next to every item on the menu was highly disturbing too.... some of these dishes had 1700+ calories... I don't need to know this. If I wanted to eat somewhere healthy I wouldn't be at CPK.  I'm noticing a trend of liking places that have bad reviews on yelp and disliking places with good reviews! Maybe I have no taste or my standards are not very high.

CPK used to be my all time favorite restaurant....and then they got rid of all their Mediterranean and Greek style foods. Their Greek pizza was one of the best pizzas I have ever had. Then one day, all of their Greek items were off the menu, and my waiter told me they got rid of all the ingredients for these items. I was devastated. I finally found another item that I liked, the Italian deli sandwich, and then I find out they took this off the menu as well! Cpk has taken off all my favorite menu items, and I am very disappointed.
This is what happens when a place is sold, watered down hummus, thinning of the already thin pizza crust and lame excuses. This place is coming off my list of places to eat.

I'm a GLUTEN-FREE brat, but this place, in fact, this entire chain pisses me off. Not because it's horrendous or I've had horrific food here, but there GLUTEN-FREE menu does not include pizza. When non-gluten-free friends suggest meeting up here, I'm always like, "Why f*cking bother. I can't have pizza there." WHY DON'T THEY HAVE PIZZA ON THEIR GLUTEN-FREE MENU?!? BJ's Pizza does. So does ZPizza. All they have on their menu is salads, which are good, but no better than one's you could get most places. Also, if you're Gluten-free, please note that the people at the location here don't really know what that means. I ordered a salad that came with some sort of tortilla strips. It was on the gluten-free menu, but just to double check, I asked if the strips were  gluten-free, and they had no idea, the chef had no idea, so I told them to skip it.  Wish this place had GF pizza and better informed employees. What's the point of having a GF menu if no one can explain it?

My wife likes the salads at California Pizza Kitchen. I think they are just average. This restaurant has been recently remodeled and the menu has some more expensive items added to it. If I had been more hungry, I might have tried one of the entrees. As it is, I had half a Cobb Salad for $10.99. My wife had the Chinese Salad for $10.79, which she liked. I had a 9 oz. carafe of their J. Lohr Cabernet Sauvignon for $14.59, which is a little bit high for this wine. The meal came with some good bread and olive oil for dipping. The restaurant is too noisy for me. Excellent service. Plenty of parking on a Wednesday night.

I have to give this particular California Pizza Kitchen the cream of the crop award.  Great food, clean, and the establishment remembers your name and even what you order. I've always seem very mixed reviews about this place and I'm a bit picky about my pizza considering that I'm Chicago boy who loves a good pizza, especially a deep dish one. Although here, I wasn't looking for pizza so much as what's good on the menu.  Every time I go back I always order the Garlic Cream Fettuccine with mushroom and chicken--don't forget the mozzarella.  Creamiest sauce I've ever tasted without overpowering the rest of the dish. And if you want something a tad healthier, I do recommend the Waldorf Chicken salad.  I mean you got to love the blue cheese, sweet walnuts, and chopped apples with chicken, all lathered with a balsamic vinaigrette that just puts everything together.  It's one of my favorites. You want cake?  You ever see those photos on the little advertisements they stick on the tables?  I saw one for velvet cake and they should have a sign on those things that says, "Objects look smaller than they appear here".  Although, this was not the case.  I ordered their velvet cake and they stick it on what looks like a huge guitar pick, but it is a thing of beauty.  The little advertisement didn't do it justice and it really is the great meal finisher... to share with friends of course.   Not something you want to eat by yourself. One of the best parts about dining here is that they have a system where you can actually pay for your meal at the table.  There's a miniature electronic kiosk at each table that allows you to pay and tip without having to wave down your waiter/waitress. Parking is really easy, but you want to avoid parking in some of the spots facing the double doors that face the street because they sit over the sewage drain and it smells as if someones rear end had a party all in the one area.

Omg I'm on crutches and am 55 years old they tried to put me in the bar I sat down, a 70 year old waitress asked my 27 year old son for id, we were having a pizza and beer.  He didn't have it, we left, I almost fell leaving the waitress left a chair in my way and I have a broken leg.  Go anywhere but here, the staff hates you, try lucilles across the street.

I have to be honest, I've shown up to the CPK appreciation party quite late in their 26 years of existence. Mind you I grew up around a father who made homemade gourmet pizzas (I swear he should have opened up his own restaurant), so the need to go out for pizza was really non-essential. But even as of recently, the lure of CPK never hit me. I've been happy with small independent pizza joints around Long Beach but after getting a gift certificate, I can now say for sure that CPK can definitely hold their own.  Since getting that gift certificate, the wife and and I have been to this location twice. Both times have been enjoyable experiences. Service was on point, although I believe all visits were made in the late afternoon. Well before the rush of post 7 PM dinners.  Food-wise, I've never disliked anything I've ordered here...with an exception for the Wild Mushroom pizza. I think this was a preference of taste, nothing "wrong" with the pizza itself. I just didn't care for the flavor profile (which is weird since I really like mushrooms). I do enjoy their small serving appetizers, especially the Mediterranean focaccia bread and the fried Mac and Cheese. They are perfect for groups of two to share...and at like 3 bucks each, you can't really beat the price.  Their full sized Cobb salad is HUGE...so if you're looking to get a normal sized salad, try to the half size order. As for their pizza, we usually split a BBQ'd Chicken Pizza. I like the crust and the BBQ sauce is pretty good. Along with the appetizers, pizza, drinks and a desert...the cost comes out just over 40 bucks with tip. I also like the fact that their pizza isn't overly greasy or filling...as a whole, eating here doesn't fill you up beyond the comfort point (although if you wanted to I'm sure you could hit that level) but allows you to eat a nice meal and fills up the hunger meter to a substantial level...yes, I'm talking as if we're SIMS here.

Tried their new broccoli and artichoke soup and wasn't that impressed.  Don't get me wrong - it was good, just expected something more.  It really seemed like broccoli soup, as I didn't really taste any artichoke. I do like that they offer so many soup options which I think they all are vegetarian. Also had the small plate asparagus and arugula salad.  Always like this - it's nice and light.  Like the addition of the sun dried tomatoes as it adds some saltiness to the dish.    Am a bit disappointed that you have to ask for a listing of their calorie and nutritional information. Don't feel like they're really in compliance with the new law by making you ask.  Plus their new items were not represented in their nutritional guide.

my favorite CPK location. Food is always on point. I love their kung pao shrimp pasta, chicken tequila lime pasta, and their pizzas... love the pepperoni, cheese, pepperoni mushroom, chicken spinach artichoke pizza, bbq chicken and the Veggie pizza. YUM! The reason why Im addicted to pizza!

CPK got it right! I've been to two CPK locations in the last couple of weeks: Long Beach (PCH/2nd St. location) and Cerritos Mall. Both were equally satisfying. The staff displays exceptional communication skills & they want you to feel comfortable. The lunch specials and the classic BBQ chicken pizza hit the spot. The Iced Tea is not watered down as is the case in many restaurants. Prices are fair and I love the wood ambiance. I will return to both locations.
Great service here!  A little packed,  so getting seated was tough but seems like 8 minutes between ordering and getting served.  :)

We came here for a celebratory dinner with my sorority. There were about 28 of us, so we took up an entire section of the restaurants. There were girls demanding MORE BREAD or WE NEED WATER over the chatters of 28 pairs of mouth, I can understand how our party could've been daunting to take on. But what they did at the end of the night was inexcusable.  But first, what I (and basically everyone) ordered - Valentine $30 course: this was a AWESOME deal that they had going on for Valentine couples. And it was A LOT of food, we had to share it between four people. Idk how two people can finish this meal. Or maybe I can, because...well, 'MURICA. We had the spinach artichoke dip, bbq chicken pizza, creamy garlic pasta AND a red velvet cake for dessert. Everything was super delicious and we all had a great time.  Now here's my gripe: at the end of the meal, they overcharge us $80! After we put in our money for the meals, we couldn't understand how we could've been short by SO much, with tax and tip included into the meal. After close inspection of the receipt, they charged us for our $30 vday meal and then charged the same items as extra items! Of course, we thought it was a mistake, but when the waitress looked at it she blatantly says it was all correct! Now we knew something was wrong. The manager came over and looked over the receipt, she then whisked away without a word and took off some items and said it was correct and she left before we looked at it. After inspecting the receipt, we were still charged extra for 3 pastas, 2 red velvet cakes and 4 pizzas. This is ridiculous! The only thing she took off was 1 pasta. We called the waitress back and showed her item by item and how were not suppose to be charged for these. The cold and lifeless look on her face says it all: she's playing dumb. Are they seriously going to cheat 26 asian girls. Uh, I don't think so! Then our blood was boiling. At the end they took off the extra items EXCEPT for one pizza. We gave up and left, the extra pizza was paid for with the tip. Two stars for the food, -500 for the shady business practice.

This place is not what it just to be.  The quality of food and management is no longer here.  I am only forced to come here because of my little girl who likes their pizza.  Don't order anything with fish, they don't know how to cook it.  They dry it every time.

After a long day of school and business meetings, my friend and I decided to go grab a quick dinner and drinks. On a Wednesday night we were seated promptly and had attentive service throughout our entire meal. Being poor college students at a place with steep prices, we shared:  - WHITE CORN GUACAMOLE + CHIPS: Wonderful guacamole. Loved the corn; it gave a sweet taste, and a textural difference. Only drawback was the ratio of guacamole-to-chip ratio was off, and we wished we got a tad bit more of guacamole.   - WHITE PIZZA: Amazing pizza, loved the little bits of ricotta all throughout. Would definitely get it again.  Only drawbacks is that I wish that our waitress refilled our bread and soda.  Overall, all CPKs have expensive prices for little portions. For that reason, I wouldn't go back. Food was definitely not worth the price if you want to get full here.
CPK is always a good place to go.. you can never go wrong. they have a great quinoa and argula salad..top with salmon and YUM!

My kids and I almost usually enjoy our time eating up the flavors of any CPK.  But for all yelping purposes, this review is for their customer service at this particular location. We were close to a party of twenty.  It was the night of my niece's graduation.   Waiting for more than twenty minutes was understandable consdering we did not make reservations and such.  That was fine.    So why the 1star?  The four older kids (12 to 14 yrs old) ordered a large pizza they told the waiter they were sharing.  Instead they receive a small size. (Since when can a group of older kids share a small size pizza? )  We ordered & requested for their bread.  Never came.  Plus, they never even came once to refill our glasses for water.   Bottom line.  I get very disappointed at any establishment when you feel like you have to flag down whoever just to get their attention for anything.  This is the worst feeling from a customer's stand point.  Its just not good practice. Would I return to this location?  Idk.  Perhaps only if Im in the area but bet your bottom dollar I will update my review!  Lets just hope we get better service next time around.

This CPK hit the spot when my friend and I were craving something good to eat, especially since we didn't have breakfast! I ordered the Salmon/Veggie Linguini which was served hot and smelled great. The Salmon cubes were a little dry. If they were small fillet pieces instead of cubes, the salmon would have been more juicy and appetizing to eat with the pasta noodles. However, the dish did taste good. My friend ordered the Veggie Fettucine which she enjoyed although there could have been a bit more vegetables, in my opinion.  I'm a fan of Iced Tea (sweet flavorful kind). I ordered their Strawberry flavored one and it was a pure disappointment. So gross. I would have preferred drinking water from the tap. Go with the peach flavored tea and you won't be disappointed. The waitress was kind enough to swap out my drink.  The service was fast and our waitress was super friendly with a cheery smile.  Try the Guacamole/Chips appetizers! It's ohhh-sooo-good! Their guac dish is superb!

The service is always very good, and everyone is always very friendly. I have never been disappointed here, and my family and I come almost once a week, and have been impressed by every food choice we have ordered. I would recommend this restaurant and even more specifically this location.

I have had the frozen pizzas before but coming here was my first experience at the actual restaurant. It was pretty good! I love the thin crust on the pizza. Only bad thing is that I felt like they took forever lol. I would come to this place if you're looking for a less expensive yet more gourmet than dominos pizza experience.
Amazing service from the manager and the entire staff. The food was so fresh and delicious our server Javier is amazing come see him Well done CPK staff !!!

Food always 4 stars, CPK is consistent and the only chain restaurant I eat at because I love their salads. Service at this location is ALWAYS horrible rude servers and greeters. This evenings warm welcoming wasn't "Hello" but there is a 30-45 minute wait. It's Sat. night so the wait time is fine but the welcome rude. We only waited 10 mins then were seated at a dirty table with crumbs all over both booth benches and table top was sticky it was obvious that it was dirty but the host put the menus on the table and was about to run away when I stopped him and asked the table be cleaned my request was apparently unreasonable to him because he rolled his eyes. He half assed cleaning the table, then we had to wait for another 10 mins to be greeted by the server.  Needless to say, another bad customer experience:. I will be ordering my food to go from this point forward.

I enjoyed  my pasta alfredo with mushrooms - as usual. The wait staff poor had to wait forever for my cocktail (think they would want to push alcohol since they make a high profit from it) and she was very slow with service overall.
I love the jambalaya noodle ( if I remembered the right name) fully seasoned  ~ and in a biiiiiiiig  portion ~ lol

Great place to come in and eat. CPK has stellar food because it's ingredients are fresh! During my excursion management was more than hospitable and the service was on point. Come here, spend your money, feel good.

I went in one day I had the best experience. Nicole was very helpful. She was very helpful with recommending new items for me to try. She was great at checking up throughout the meal. She really made the meal wonderful. I will be going back and requesting her to be my waitress!

Came here with a friend for an early dinner. Our wait was very short and the front desk staff was so sweet about it!   James was our server and he was the best! He was so attentive and sweet enough to bring us extra pita bread -- which was delicious !      He was so sweet and we will definitely come back and sit in his section!

I love California Pizza Kitchen so when it was suggested as a place for dinner, I naturally got excited. I was told the cross streets and tried to use Yelp to help me with directions.  But it didn't have this location listed.  It was listed on CPK's website so I knew it had to exist.  I was already familiar with the area, so all I had to do was look for a Ruby's and I knew it was right behind that.  Once I had gotten there, I knew I had visited this location like 3 or 4 years ago.  So for it not to be listed on Yelp was a surprise. We go inside and I notice that everyone working was professionally dressed (button down shirt and black slacks) compared to earlier in the week when I visited a CPK at the Anaheim Garden Walk where the workers were dressed in whatever they wanted to wear. So when I saw the employees here, I was relieved that CPK hadn't lowered their standards on how to dress. I got my traditional cheese pizza and my friend ordered a salad. Mine was very good and his salad was great.  The place was clean and the staff was very friendly

My hubby and I usually love CPK and we love the fact that we can get our food curbside, but this CPK has to have the absolute worst curbside. We have ordered curbside here 3 times and each time they make us wait up to an HOUR after the time promised for them to come out with our food. I would understand if we were ordering huge meals but all we get are salads so they really have no excuse for making us wait this long.

I am a little surprised by their 3 star rating at this location and if I really think about it, perhaps it has something to do with service (they can be really busy and a tad bit rushed at this location) or at least that has been my experience as they are a relatively small CPK location.  So, I suppose they can get crowded and easily overwhelmed.  However, the food is quality and I have never had less than an overall 4 star experience here. I love their salads, pizza and pasta...The original chopped salad is amazing and I love the dressing which comes with it - I could eat this salad every day and never grow tired of it.  I always get thin crust pizza's and they are equally tasty (no matter which one I get but my favorite is the pepperoni - I am pretty much a creature of habit but I have tried the bque chicken, the thai chicken and the artichoke/spinach and honestly they are all quite delicious).   Pizza is one of those menu items which is very personal and subjective and imost likely if you come from NY, you just may not find our Cali pizza to be to your quite biased liking (I am from Cali but have eaten plenty of NY pizza, which I love as well) but in no way does it diminish CPK pizza - apples and oranges really.  However, both are equally savory in their own unique ways. Their pasta dishes are delicious and filling.  While admittedly not authentic Italian to some - they are pretty close to the mark and you will not be dissapointed with all the unique, flavorful, pasta delights they offer.

The green pea and barley soup is delicious. The barley adds a subtle texture to the soup. Their Margherita pizza (with original crust) tastes very good. The tomatoes are semi-sweet and the  basil adds a nice flavor. They have a new device on each table that allows customers to play games or pay for their meal via credit card if they cannot or do not want to wait for the server. Torri was extremely kind to me and my family. She made our visit to CPK a happy event!

I went in yesterday for lunch to Cpk as I do from time to time. It's close to my office and it always has delicious food. I was surprised and pleased when I had Angela as my server because I hadn't seen her for a while and I've had her a few times before. She remembered me immediately and made me feel like she cared about her job and her customers. She was very welcoming and funny too. Had a salad and must say whoever was making the salads yesterday got it down. Pat was the manager, he stopped by my table and was also very friendly. Bottom line it was a lunch spot I will be going to more and will ask to be seated with Angela. Easy on the eyes too. Great spot!
Always great food, great service, good prices! Wish they would not change the menu's so often! The new remodeled Resturante May 2015 is great!

My mom and I decided to come to CPK after watching a movie at the nearby UA theater. We were immediately greeted by a group a friendly hostesses. We came around 4:00pm on a Friday so the lunch crowd had gone and they were prepping for the dinner crowd. Our server Robin greeted us immediately and took our drink orders. We decided to try the "small plates" as our appetizer. Our server did offer to put a complimentary bread basket on the table but we declined because we knew we were going to go into carb overload. It was nice that she asked first instead of just plopping it on the table. Who can resist warm bread?  Anyway, we truly enjoyed the small plates. I had the asparagus arugula salad and my mom had the petite wedge. Both were very refreshing and different from your typical run of the mill salads. We were in a pizza kind of mind so we chose to have the new roasted garlic chicken pizza and the meat cravers pizza. Let me just say CPK knows how to make pizza honey. Both pizzas were absolutely mouth watering. I like the pizza dough that they use. It's so light and flaky. Whenever I eat pizza at other establishments I feel stuffed after eating 2 slices but CPK pizzas aren't like that. The ingredients on the pizza are the stars not the dough which means you really get the full taste of the pizza and not just a mouth full of crust. We didn't save room for dessert but the dessert menu looked appetizing. I would like to try their molten lava chocolate cake next time because there will definitely be a next time.

I grew up eating CPK, so for me it doesn't get much better than this.  My boyfriend and I go here 2 or 3 times a month. Some of my favorites are the baja tortilla spring rolls, the chicken dumplings, smashed pea barley soup, bbq chicken chop salad, tostada pizza, chicken tequila fettucini and the butter cake.  The service in this particular location has always been pretty great, but if you come with a big party it will take a while. My one issue with CPK is that they happen to take my favorite thing off the menu all the time. For example: shrimp scampi pizza, carne asada pizza and (most recently) the Tuscan Panzanella salad.

Just had another excellent meal here. The food, service, and atmosphere have been really good the last several times we've been here. Love the caramelized peach salad, Chicken Milanese, peach soda, key lime pie. Service was very attentive. We were warmly welcomed. Atmosphere was very comfortable, lively, crowded. A really pleasant evening.

I usually don't write reviews when I have a good experience at a restaurant but for some reason this California pizza kitchen seamed very friendly and very attentive with every customer. Kirsten the manager is very nice and seamed genuinely interested in talking with us. Paul our server is a happy guy who stayed positive even when we changed our order last minute and the hostess opened our door as we left. I will definitely come back here for another date night :)

One of the few chains I can tolerate---In a pinch.  At least you know what you're getting every single time you go, no matter where you are.  This is HUGE. The service and the food are VERY consistant.  Major Kudos for that. I like that they are big enough that they are required to post the calories, and therefore I can calculate a nice low calorie, healthy meal.  I order from the appetizer menu most times I go here.  I also like the super duper thin crust pizza and the miso salad. Decent beverage list and it works for the kiddos.

It was hard to give CPK 3 Stars...but if the service is HORRIBLE (as we experienced) my overall Rating is going to be "A-OK" Our server was by far one of the worst I've had in a very long time, he couldn't remember if we were drinking sprite or water, he said he had given me diet coke when it was really diet pepsi, it took him 15 minutes to bring out a long island iced tea when it was sitting up on the counter the entire time, he didn't bring out the bread we had asked for that came with our appetizer, he forgot to bring the sauces for our meals, then to top it off he started having a bad attitude problem because he kept forgetting the entire order, not to mention the manager who came over to see "how we were doing" turns out to have attitude too and was just rude, not sure if these guys were 4:20 partners in crime but it was just horrible Bbq chicken pizza was delicious, the spinach artichoke dip was good (normally it comes warm, not cold) the long island top shelf was very good and stiff... of course by this time we didn't mind the ice being watered down "/ no worries this all reflected on our all-star servers tip...the food was overall good hence the crappy service

This is one of the better chain eateries.  They are consistent with the quality of food in every location I've ever been to.  I really like the small plates menu and the BBQ chicken salad.  Service is usually good.  No complaints here.

Went here for a fundraiser for my daughter's preschool. The food was typical for a CPK, no complaints. They changed their bread and you don't get butter anymore, but the change was for the better. The new bread is delicious! The service was just OK, nothing special.

Went on a Friday night with a 15 minute wait. Wait was not too bad, but once we sat at our table it took our waiter ten minutes to greet us and get our drink orders. He then took another five minutes to come back with the drinks. One other complaint: The noise level was amazingly loud in this place. There were people nearly shouting at each other just to be heard. Not sure why the noise level was so loud, but it was annoying.  The food was the only positive thing as it tasted great. However, our appetizer took ten minutes to come out and our meals took another 15 minutes after that. Meanwhile, all of this time our waiter was nowhere to be seen.  They have these new kiosks one each table that show you pictures of menu items and let you pay your bill directly at the table whenever you want. They sound good on paper, but most of them were being used by children as entertainment because their parents are too busy to notice.  I am not surprised they have these kiosks here because the waiters are never around and take forever to do anything. Of course as soon as we started to pay the bill via the kiosk, the waiter showed up and tried to sound like our best friend so we would give him a good tip. Lousy service, good food and long wait times for the food and drinks bring this place at a steady 2 starts.

I love cpk but I will never come back to this location.  The waitstaff here was horrible.  No one greeted us at the door and we had to wait for 5 minutes for anyone to come and seat us and it was dead in there.  Next our waitress could not count and kept giving us the wrong number of plates and utensils.  She never came back to check our drinks or see how we were doing and let me repeat how dead it was in there.  There was no reason why it should've taken her so long to come to our table.  Even after giving us our bill it took forever for her to pick it up, we almost went to carry our bill up front to pay.  I was really disappointed in this location and to top it off my pasta was dry and lacking.  I will not be coming back to this cpk.

I invited my US Navy Vet hubby to go to lunch at this CPK in Long Beach on Veteran's Day.  He enjoyed his FREE Habanero Carnitas pizza, and I had the California Club pizza - both were excellent. Even better than the food quality and quantity was the excellent service.  We were both impressed that the whole crew rotated throughout the dining area helping to greet, serve, welcome, help and make all of the vets who were there feel so appreciated!  They shook our hands, smiled, and made us feel so special.  To add to this exceptional service, the CPK staff gave my vet a card saying "With Gratitude", in honor of Veterans Day. All of the staff had personally signed the card! It brought tears to my eyes that a large corporation could be so kind.  The pizza was a gift, the card was a treasure!  He certainly felt the gratitude, and so did I.  Great job everybody!

I used to come here a lot when they had the baby clam linguini, but since they eliminated it from the menu, there isn't really anything else that sounds good (I do love the BBQ chicken salad when I'm in a salad mode). So tonight I tried something from their Lite Menu, the chile relleno. It was pretty good. It didn't come with any sides, but that's ok since I wasn't super hungry.  I also ordered an iced tea to drink. It was very good. For dessert I ordered a tiramisu and my wife ordered the butter cake. I've always loved the tiramisu and it was still as good as always. I sampled the butter cake and it was awesome!  I decided to take the tiramisu to-go and dove into that tasty butter cake. I've had butter cake from other restaurants and this is one of the best. Our waiter was great. He was very welcoming. Even the manage came to our table to ask how everything was. Tonight's dinner was a very good experience.

Hubby and I had a gift Cerf to CPK, we have had it for a few months. Finally we decided to use it, this was my first time eating at CPK.  We Ordered:  App: Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese & Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings  Pizza: Sicilian  Drinks: Strawberry Lemonade and Coke.  The food was great! Both starters were tasty, bread crumbs on the mac "n" cheese had some flavor. The hubby had always wanted to try the sesame dumplings, which were fab. I am a pizza lover and will def be eating this pizza again. The lemonade was on the sweet side (I had 4 glasses, free refills.) The service was OK, had to remind our server for some items that she said she would bring. She was running around, her section was busy! Over all we will def go back and try a different pizza and maybe a pasta dish.
