My wife and I love CPK. Always good food. This review is on the service received at this location. Now going the day before Christmas EVE I knew it was going to be busy, I had no problem with that. We were actually seated within 5 minutes and the place was packed. For some reason our waitress(Mary) was also tending the bar. She got us our drinks, bread, and took our order. That was the last time she came over until it was time for the check! We ordered a cup of fruit for our daughter that was supposed to come before dinner, it didn't. We waited 40 minutes for our food. My wife had to ask another waitress about our food. When it finally came the "To Go" guy brought it over. My wifes order was completely wrong so she had to wait even longer. After that, no one, and I mean no one came over to check on us. I saw managers and waiters flying by with food and tending to other customers. Just not us. Our table was within eye sight of the bar. I could see my waitress working the bar the entire time. She completely forgot about us. Next time I saw her it was time for the check. That took forever too. I could have walked in the kitchen and complained to the manager but, at this point I just wanted to get out of there as we were going to see Christmas lights. I would think twice about going to this location...

I was pleasantly surprised by the great experience at California Pizza Kitchen in Long Beach tonight.  First, of all the service was phenomenal on a Friday evening! Secondly, the food came out rather quickly. We had a half salad and chicken quesadilla with peach iced teas which were pretty good!  The nice benefit that made the experience even better was this new technology at each table that has a screen where you can see the menu and even pay for your bill at your table. You can adjust what percentage you want to add for your server's tip. The machine even allows you to get a simple or detailed receipt. No more do you need to flag down your server...you can simply pay your bill when you are ready to leave. I was impressed.

The call center they used got my order wrong yea a call center haha. The manager quickly came and went out of her way to fix it. Offered the meal for free but I paid. Gave me pie and coke. Excellent way to fix the problem. The service has always been excellent here.

Far too expensive and inconsistent. I went there yesterday for lunch and ordered Chicken Milanese, supposedly Panko Crust. What I expected was Pasta with the Chicken on the side instead I got a greasy Salad on top of the Chicken which made the whole thing soggy and whoever came up with that concept should be shot. I'm from Italy and I understand that Veal is politically incorrect here in the States so you substitute it with Chicken... fine, but then charge it like chicken not like Veal. All I can say is was inedible and the staff was just awful, the server actually was sitting next in a both talking with her friends instead of taking care of her tables. I used to like this place but never again!!

This is more like an okay review, our host was really nice and friendly but our server never smiled, and kind of had an attitude when I said I wanted to return the chicken tequila fettuccini (really didn't have much of the flavor I was looking for) then got the pesto cream penne with chicken (I don't understand why I paid 3$ more just for 6 small pieces of chicken, kind of a rip off) hardly had any pesto flavor, BUT the pizza here is good as well as the soups which is why I feel bad giving a 3 star review but the "fan favorites" were really bland in flavor.

Good Food, Great Location fast and friendly service. Came for a basket ball tournament so looked for something good and fast and luckly I found this place not knowing what to expect since I dont know the area but I was suprise with all the good service..

Tonight's dinner was brought to you by California Pizza Kitchen (this location). My friends and I decided to get food, and one of them was craving CPK... so, we ended up here. It wasn't our first visit to this location. Upon arriving, they greeted us, and although it was fairly busy, we were sat pretty much immediately. It wasn't long before our server greeted us and asked if we had any questions and what we'd like to drink.  We were starving, so we were ready to order as soon as our drinks and bread arrived. I don't stray away from my usual orders often, so I ordered what I normally get at CPK - the BBQ chicken salad. Well, YUUUMMM! I don't know if I was super hungry or what, but today, the BBQ chicken salad just tasted amazing! We shared the butter cake at the end, and it satisfied all our sweet tooths... teeth? Lol. Our server was very attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I'd definitely recommend him as your server if you decide to visit! I'm pretty sure his name was Paul - like 95%. Anyway, I would recommend this place, and I will be visiting again!

This place has one of the worst customer service ever. I did a pick up order there was no hostess greeting anybody. I actually had to track down an employee to get my order. I shouldn't have to go to any workers they should be serving me. There were plenty of worker and they saw me but totally ignored me. I definitely will NOT be coming here ever again. It wasn't even a busy night.

Came here for lunch for Veterans Day and couldn't be more pleased with this restaurant. Everybody on staff made it a noticeable effort to accommodate my family and I. This companies continued dedication to our armed force is nothing short of incredible. I will be a life long customer. I had the Hawaiian pizza and my son had a cheese pizza. Everything was better than expected. All ingredients seemed fresh and well prepared.

For a not-busy Monday, it took forever to get our food. We were starving! Finally it arrives - my Asparagus & Arugula Salad ($4.95) was okay. But the Sesame Chicken Dumplings ($7.50) were delicious!!  Unfortunately my friend's BBQ Chicken salad he described as "flavorless." Our waitress was kind of new and slow with checking in and refills. She also was temporarily stumped as to how to create a new "Pizza Dough" account. Overall it was a so-so meal.
Always pleasant service and attentive staff. Menu has improved but we miss the old soft bread slices :(

I remember when CPK first came out, it was the rage, and the pizzas were good.  But on my recent visit, the thin crust pizza was sub par.  We ordered the thin crust pepperoni pizza to share with our salads.  The crust was so tough and chewy and unflavorful, it was pathetic.  We should've sent it back.   On the good side of the meal, my Thai Crunch salad was very good and tasty.  The salad has chopped lettuce, cabbage, edamame, cilantro, green onions with chicken,  peanuts, wontons and rice sticks, tossed in spicy Thai peanut dressing.  Add avocado to it, is a couple of bucks extra.  The salad definitely saved the meal.  I'd come back to have this salad alone.  Forget the crappy disappointing pizza. Service was friendly and fast.  Parking at the Marketplace can get pretty difficult to find on a Friday and Saturday evening.
Yes please!!! Our server/bartender Mary made the best margarita and apple martini!!!! Oh and the food was on point Roasted Garlic Chicken was finger liking good!!!

I don't do much reviewing of chain restaurants but I love the service at this one! 4 stars just for that! I mean it's a CPK, pizza isn't the best. Except the pear and Gorgonzola. That one is SO good! A little overpriced. Their drinks are strong at this one, which is good. And they have really good salads! We've ordered online to-go at this location too and the process was always smooth. But I've never had bad service here. Always quick, always friendly. It's an quick local go to for an easy lunch or dinner.

I like this location. Its really open and airy. Service is great, food is always good. I ordered a soup I didn't like and they switched it out and took it off my bill and were super friendly about it. A+ in my book. Will always make this location my number 1!
The worst $26.99 steak I'd ever have. They are great with the pizzas and today i wanted to try their steak, and I totally regret it. Great service.

I love the pizzas at CPK.  One of my favorites is the Thai Chicken, and so I ordered it here on my first visit. It came out perfectly prepared and tasty.  It was the highlight of dining here, but unfortunately the overall experience  was not as good as it should have been. ...which brings me to why I am giving this CPK only 3 stars... Their service here was about as slow as it gets.  We were here for at least 45 minutes longer than we needed to be.  Our waiter and the hostess were actually very friendly and great.  The issue was that they were so understaffed that we hardly saw them and had to wait for a long time for everything. I should have realized there would be an issue when we arrived on a Wednesday night and there was no hostess at the front.  She was apparently helping the wait staff, but then came running to get my name once she saw us at the front counter.  She told us that it would be a 5-10 minute wait (even though 2/3rds of the seating was empty).  So we came back 15 minutes later, and when she saw us she came running up again and seated us.  That pretty much set the tone for the rest of our time here.  Both the hostess and our waiter were as friendly as could be, but it was obvious that they were very understaffed.  What was a great meal was dampened by having to wait so long for each and every thing.  I'd rather visit another CPK that has enough staff to operate the restaurant appropriately.  It was a huge waste of time, and it makes me hesitant to eat here again.

This C.P.K. location is the best!!!! They are very friendly here, and make you feel welcome everytime you come in. Kenneth is a great server, and he remembers what you like, and serves with a smile. Bee is very sweet, and opens the door to greet you. The Cobb salad is delicious, and salted caramel pudding for dessert. Perfect everytime!

CPK is alright overall. Sat.evening 7pm.  Customer service: Frank (big buff guy) was our server and he just was okay. He was just mediocre if that. Got seated right away which was good.  I ordered a wedge side-salad that was good & super crunchy & asked for blue cheese crumbs on the side. He brought it promptly. Ordered some teas. & got a soup on the side. I didn't like the soup and told the server and didn't even touch it @ all I had but one spoonful & didn't enjoy it. He charged me still, a bit disappointed. Didn't asked if he could get me anything else either. If I do choose to go back maybe I'll just stick to a pizza :/ P.S. The sourdough dough bread served with oil will break your teeth, super hard hard crust, just eat the inside.

Stopped in here for lunch today and was very pleased with the service and the food. Dining alone can be a bit of a challenge at some places and I was glad it wasn't here. I will be back! I tried one of the seasonal pizzas, the Tricolore with grilled shrimp and I wasn't disappointed.  My server, Mikey was great!

Horrible service. Horrible food. I came to California from Las Vegas,NV on a little getaway. Me and my family drove 30 minutes to this CPK because we always go to it here in Vegas and they always treat us good here. And the food is always good here. We were  starving!!!! Our server was horrible. We didn't get our drinks for a long time. He didn't even bring us straws. When I finally saw him again I asked him for straws. 10 min later he brings them. Then He brought us our appetizer. Then brings us our pizza and me and my mom ordered a pasta to share. He literally dropped the food on the table and left. No silver wear. No napkins nothing. We look for him for like 10min. Finally see him and ask him for silver wear and napkins. 10min later he finally brings them. The food by then was cold. The pasta was disgusting!!!! Hard. Not creamy at all. No taste. Just disgusting ! The pizza was super thin. The cheese super hard. It was tough to even bite into the pizza. Everything was just disgusting. We didn't even see our server as we ate. Never checked up on us. No refills. Nothing. We ate because we were starving and my 3yr old daughters couldn't wait any longer or else we would've gone somewhere else. McDonalds would've probably tasted and treated us better. When the server finally brings us our check I realize he didn't even charge us our drinks.... Im guessing to justify his lack of service. So unprofessional. It's a shame that this location represents CPK. I used to be a big fan. Now I'm not sure when I'll eat at another one again!!! Forgot to get the servers name. But he was a tall young hipster guy with a big long mustache. If u even consider going to this location. Make sure you don't get his section. ZERO STARS.
Coming a Long Way from El Paso, TX, we received great service from all staff, including management. They were kind enough to ensure the orders of our dishes were 100%. Thank you for the hospitality.

Came in for dinner Tiffany was our server. I have to commend her on stellar customer service. Haven't had such a amazing server in a long time. She knew the drink menu Very well she suggested her favorites off the menu and even sung happy birthday with our group for our friend. The sangria is awesome not to sweet! We had great pizza and pasta. Would defiantly come back. What great customer service which is rare these days when dining out

food bad server had a attitude , i dont believe how u gonna serve steak ,but u dont serve steak sauce how backards is this place just stick wit your nasty pizza who the heck eat steak without sauce, maybe they are racist.      put on the menu u dont have steak sauce  then maybe we wont order steak 24 dollars but no sauce piss me off... then on top of that people my coworker had hair in his food wooowwww how nasty are they!!!!! but chris the manager was nice enough to take off the chicken... but still no steak sauce!!! never will go back

Terrible. Ordered for delivery. Took just under two hours. When the food arrived, all was cold and pizza was rubbery. I can't believe they charged $58.00 for this. I still tipped the delivery guy 7 bucks. It is absurd to even call this pizza.

This has become our favorite chain restaurant  to eat each week.  I love their Sicilian thin crust pizza, but have drifted to eating a 1/2 order of the Original Bbq Chopped Chicken salad.  I am normally not a salad person, but chose this one time as I have been working on my fitness and was pleasantly surprised how fresh and tasty the salad was.  This is now my favorite diet meal I look forward to eating. We always share a piece of Red Velvet cake for dessert and it never lasts long. We find the people working at this location to be very pleasant and we like the overall vibe.

I don't give a lot of 5-star ratings.   1) Restaurant was immaculately kept.  Bathrooms clean, tables bussed, appointments all in good order and clean. 2) Sever, Ashley, was attentive (but not intrusive), knowledgeable and truly seemed to enjoy being at work.  That is a big plus as it transmits clearly to the customers. 3) One of us had the Chinese Chicken Salad.  Ingredients (lettuce, etc) fresh, crispy noodles were indeed crispy, chicken well-prepared and tasty, and the ginger dressing was wonderful.  The reason I go into such detail is that we had a similar salad at PF Changs in NPB last week and it was awful on each of the counts listed above. 4) The other in our party had the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine.  The zucchini was obviously fresh, the noodles cooked perfectly al dente, and the shrimp was decent sized and tasty.  Loads and loads of garlic (now isn't that why you order a scampi?) and lots of grated cheese.  Really a wonderful dish. I like CPK but I really enjoyed today's visit.
I come here a lot for lunch. It depends on the server, how quick your food will be. I usually only get salads but, it depends on who the server is on how long it will take

hmmmmm chain restaurants are not my normal choice, I go out of my way to avoid them but sometimes I can't.  I'm giving 4 stars to CPK I like the calorie counter on the menu I think this is a great tool to fight the battle of the yelp bulge it saved me and the wife 1100 calories on the avocado eggs rolls WTF it's an appetizer so we had the chicken dumplings instead tasted OK we split the field greens salad very good.  I like their Sicilian pizza, its always reliable tastes good and fresh. The only con I can give CPK is that they are a little too proud of their food and charge a little too much, service is always solid at this location.

I have been to many CPKs but this one is the best as far as food and service. The last time I was there with friends, we were greeted by the cutest and sweetest hostess named Kenzie. You could tell that she genuinely was friendly.  We were seated in less than 5 min. and after we ordered it took less than 10 min. to get our food. I can't remember our waiters name, but he was very attentive. The pizzas are great but my favorite item is Kung Pao Spaghetti. You have to try the chocolate soufflé cake! TOO DIE FOR!!

As a New Yorker, I'm very picky with my pizza. I ordered the grilled chicken pesto and it was serious. I brought some home to my friend and she loved it so much, that she had me go to her local pizza joint (equally as good) to pick up some more! Our server, Sara, was awesome. She flowed very nicely with my two buddies (a fellow NYer from dominican republic and a partial NYer from puerto rico) and I. Between our vulgarity and our pronunciation of words not common to Westerners, she did okay. She was even nice enough to split our bill into three (didnt make a face about it at all)!

I went and visited a friend in long beach, cpk is an old favorite and we wanted bbq chicken salads for dinner... there was a wait and we figured typical chain rest... wrong! this hostess girl was taking charge running around our waiter was on top of it, the manager came by asked everyone how they were doing at every table!.... food was fantastic as always(it was a salad) but it was still great... its funny I checked in here a couple months back and just now am writing the review... but i can still remember how great it was!

I know everyone knows about CPK (I think that there are 5 within 5 miles of my house), but I just wanted to review it because we went there last night for dinner and our service was soooooooo AWESOME. It's usually hit or miss at CPK with the service, but you always know what you are getting with the food, so it seems worth it sometimes (and they are sooo kid-friendly, which is nice for our 2 yo). But, our server last night will make us definitely go back to the location in the Marina instead of the others around us. I think it was the best service we have EVER gotten at a CPK. Oh - - and all of their soups are now vegetarian!!!

I went in and sat at the bar with Michelle and she pleasantly greeted me. She recommended a lemon drop martini, which was delicious! My friend had a margarita which he liked too. I would recommend the CPK Cobb, maybe put the dressing on the side (seemed to be a little much). When I said something to our bartender Michelle, she was more than accommodating and got a new one for me. We also had the Thai Chicken Spring Rolls! Yum! I definitely recommend siting at the bar, more casual and seemed to have very prompt service!!!

Went this afternoon to grab lunch with my 3 kids.  We come here once and awhile, we live in the neighborhood.  The food was delicious as usual.  I am writing this review because of the amazing service I received.  Our servers name may have been Nortin?..(or something similiar to that).

I like CPK for what it is. I love their Cobb salad and I like their variety of pizza choices. Tonight my partner and I went their together and had to wait 5-10 minutes, and we were immediately seated after a 7 top seated in a four person booth (we had our own booth the same size for the two of us). Our waitress was obviously frazzled and they were ordered and served apps before she even got to us. Another busser had to come by and take our drink orders and bring some bread because we were obviously forgotten for the first 15 minutes. Food was good. It came out VERY fast which really upped the experiance. My girl has never been here and she enjoyed her Hawaiian pizza and the Cobb salad hit the spot. I left happy. For a Tuesday night I would expect better service, but overall it wasn't bad at all.
The service is excellent here!  Our server was very friendly.  The atmosphere is casual and the food is awesome.

well first off this is my first time to a real CPK meal other than the Styrofoam pizzas they sell at the airport which needless to say doesn't count. First impression was good. -black clad wait staff was very busy but efficient so the place wasnt hectic. -liked the fact that they provide a mini menu with all the dietary info for the health conscious out there. -tab for 3 adults 2 kids was $80  -our server was friendly but not very proactive. -had the grilled veggie salad with blackened salmon & bowl of the white bean minestrone * * * * *  hell ya. im going to make it at home. over all I gave it four stars for being a great restaurant.  -good menu -layout, appearance/decor, bar but what makes it a comfortable experience and sets one from another is the staff.

Awful! I used to love California Pizza Kitchen's tiramisu but now not only do their pizzas suck, but their tiramisu is almost inedible. I've been totally disappointed with everything I've had from this place in the last four years. I'm done.

I phoned in an order... and they said 10 minutes.... GREAT!   OK    On my way to work and this is perfect  curbside... .. until i get there.    I told the person on the phone  I needed bread and butter for 2 people along with the bbq avocado(which cost 2 bucks more on 2 .. 1/2 salads)   and u only give me 1 bread in a bag..  um NOT! THEN when I pay with my Gift Card (cause I buy them @ costco = 50 bucks) and its 25 and some change..   & U DO not RETURN.. I have issues ... NO    its not ur TIP! SO SAD!    i have to call the curbside number again and ask for him to return.... AND I have to explain that  I want my change!!!!!!!!!!!!! 20 minutes later u do not deserve crap!!!  minus a tip! MAKES ME NOT TO GO BACK THERE!  sorry

Commending them for the free pizza they gave to all veterans on Veteran's Day. We could choose from any pizza--usually these give aways limit you to the most unpopular pizzas, but their generosity to the men and women who served/serve our country was awesome. Also I read a lot of complaints about service at this restaurant. Beth served us as well as other veterans who only came in for the free pizza, and she was gracious, happy and made everyone feel special even though she knew the tab wasn't going to be high (ie tied to tips). That didn't matter to her; she just wanted everyone to be happy. So ask for her and you will get 5 star service. Thank you again CPK and Beth.
What can I say, chain restaurant. Food is good, service is good, all I can say is I'm sure everyone has been to one of these at least once in there lifetime.

This place is awesome. Yes, it's a chain, but until I can get this kind of food at a local Long Beach restaurant, I'll keep going back. Their flatbread pizzas have amazing flavors and their pasta is always just right.

This CPK is one of my favrate CPk's. The place is always busy and the Food gets 2 stars, the Service gets 2 stars and Clean Store half a star if I could give it one.  The store is busy and restroom is never ever that clean. I understand do to how busy they are... But I have been here over a 2 doz times and they really should just hire someone to just keep FOH cleaner. But the food and the staff are *****.

Poor service, never got the bread they told they were going to bring us.  I love the pizza but what a rip off.  My wife had pasta for $12 and my pizza was around $12, with drinks and tip it was almost $40.  Could have made the pasta at home ($4)and bought a frozen CPK pizza for $6.  So if the service was bad why go there?  Not in this day and age.  I ALWAYS feel like I get ripped off when I leave a CPK.  I am done with them!

While all you Yelp Elites were out partying at the OYE in Culver City -- I went Christmas Tree shopping. Jealous? Afterwards, we decided -- and I really don't know what possessed us -- to go to California Pizza Kitchen for dinner.  I've never really been a fan of CPK, but they do have decent spring rolls and artichoke dip. The pizza is a little hit or miss; I have always favored the Jamaican Jerk pizza over the rest.  We started off with the shrimp spring rolls served with a ginger sesame sauce. Nothing to rave about -- simple, fresh and...simple. The bruschetta dish was not all that great. We were served an entire loaf of focaccia cheese bread and extremely thick (almost whole) tomatoes. They could have chopped the tomatoes a little smaller and perhaps helped out with the slicing of the bread. To sit there and slice your own bread is a bit of an inconvenience considering there are others who wish to share the dish and would rather not have multiple hands on the bread.  (Take note) We ordered the Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza; which was rather dry and lacked flavor. I was disappointed with this pizza -- but not surprised it sucked. The service was standard; the waitress came by from time to time and topped off our drinks and flashed a smile. Perhaps I should have voiced my opinion, but I was unmotivated. Gourmet pizza should be left to places that don't offer franchise opportunities. Once you go chain -- your food is a pain. *Thank you. Thank you.*

I am reviewing only to say that the vegetarian with japanese eggplant pizza, on neapolitan dough, with no cheese, is one of the best vegan pizzas I've ever had. If you wanna get crazy add avocado, but it's definitely not necessary.

Good service accompanied by garbage food.  This place probably gets a kick back from olive oil companies.  The pepperoni was oily on top from the pepperoni and on the bottom from the crust.     If you want to be morbidly obese like me I recommend eating here every day.

WOW!! i didn't expect to read so many bad reviews about cpk i love that place... i love their lettuce wraps, kung pao shrimp spaghetti and their Sicilian pizza... i their chicken tequila pasta is great too but if you can't eat it within 10 mins. of arriving, all of the olive oil seeps out yuck :P if the waitress or waiter are being a douche i don't tip the fuckerssssssss to the ones that sucked... :)
Great service great food. Good server dessert was the shissnits. About the other review ... its a restaurant don't order out that's what pizza hut is for .  Lump
have lunched several times - never a taste delight . their lemonade - hnorrible.  their bread icecold -2 oz of chicken is $4.50''  too pricey.
i can't decide who has worse pizza... papa john's or cpk? definatley a thumbs down to both. stick with DiGornios or however you spell it!
Good menu selection. Average chain restaurant service. Love the new digital menus and checkout on the tables!

Ok so i have an update now. The stars stay the same because it still didn't feel like a 5 start to me. But I wanted to try something new so i tried the Chinese chicken salad and it was pretty good. I have had a few versions of Chinese chicken salad and i would say it's near the top. I also tried the artichoke dip and it was warm and delicious. I will probably get that again next time i go. The server was a cool guy and i never had an empty cup. I would have a new one before i finished my current drink. Most of the time the service was good, but sometimes you get those people that forget about you or just don't care and you have to ask for a refill. Parking sometimes sucks because it gets busy with people going to different restaurants in the plaza or people going to Red Robins. So it would probably be wise to go a little bit earlier then planned... if you ever plan on going. :)
love their new spinach + grilled chicken pesto pizza! full bar + awesome tiramisu.  overall, if you are in LB and want some CPK,  come to this one, not the one on Pine.  faster + friendlier service.

CPK is CPK... i usually get the BBQ chopped salad, waldorf salad, or their soup... but i was impressed by their automated paying system... loved that i didn't have to wait for the server to bring us our check... and the system emails me the receipt!  love it!

Wow what happened to CPK?  The food used to be pretty good, and it was pizza pasta and salads.  Now it might as well be TGIF, a bunch of greasy fried appetizers, Mexican (!) food ...and the most awful hummus I've ever had.  Are they trying to be all things to all people and not doing any of it very well?  This location is quite noisy, all we could hear was clattering flatware and plates.  Actually had quite good service, friendly, attentive and pretty fast. But the food just isn't good enough.

ZERO STARS!!!!!!!!!!! The service was HORRIBLE!  Our server came to introduce herself and never came back to our table though she was walking around helping everyone else around us.  We had to wave her down after 15 minutes to place our order.  After 40 minutes and seeing that other people who sat around us had come and gone, we decided to say something.  The server apologized and the manager came over and apologized and explained that their oven was "broken".... I sure don't know how other folks got their pizzas.  Our server also never brought us any bread though every other table had bread.  He apologized and said that they would get us bread right away.  Sure enough they brought us our bread, but how were supposed to eat our bread without any plates or cutlery?????  We finally just left.  PLEASE STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Today I found that I had fallen amongst a party of nine whose utter contempt for my finer sensibilities led to lunch at CPK.  I suppose I should be grateful that they weren't collectively seized by a sense of nostalgia leading to  the recently opened Bob's Big Boy franchise in Signal Hill.   We arrived during the Sunday lunch rush so we understandably had to wait a bit before our party could be accommodated.  After about fifteen minutes, the hostess asked if we would mind being seated at adjoining booths.  We agreed and were soon led to two booths that were joined by nothing less than three interceding booths and one aisle.  I suppose we could have maintained a sense of solidarity using walkie-talkies, but nobody thought far enough ahead to bring a set.   After waiting a bit longer, we were seated at two booths across the aisle from one another.  Our waiter arrived and took drink orders from our booth before proceeding to take food and drink orders from the half of our group seated across the aisle. To make a long story short, our meal order was taken approximately fifteen minutes later.  Our meal arrived about the time that our companions were finished with theirs.   I eventually received an order of "Shanghai garlic noodles with shrimp" (Chinese noodles wok-stirred in a garlic-ginger sauce with snow peas, Shiitake mushrooms, mild onions, red and yellow peppers, baby broccoli and scallions).  It was good, but I'll be damned if the same meal doesn't come frozen in a plastic bag at Trader Joe's.

Ok place to eat! It's a chain so the food is exactly how it should be, ok service, can be super busy on the Friday-Sunday's. A full bar and fun atmosphere. A new updated menu and if you try something new and hate it you can get your money back. A safe but goody is the bbq chicken pizza.

I know it's a corporate business, but I am compelled to write about it because it's the most incredible CPK ever. I've been coming to this location for years. They have the the most responsive and friendly servers, along with a selection of food  (aside from pizza) that has never disappointed me. Again, you will not find happier and more "with it" servers in the business. More often than not the wait for food to hit the table is short, though on busier evenings it may take a few minutes longer. Everyone I've taken here agrees this is the best cpk they've been to. The only downside is the corporate feel and the fact that the menu hardly changes, but sometimes "no surprises" can be a good thing!

This is our local CPK near Belmont Shore. The typical finger-lickin' good old CPK. Dunno what it is exactly it is, but don't we all crave CPK sometimes? Don't we all... Location in Belmont Shore is OK (close to Naples island & the marina); service is OK, some of the pizzas are really good... My fav pizzas are: Napoli Tricolore (fresh salad-style), Thai Chicken, Pear & Gorgonzola Cheese, Goat Cheese & Roasted Peppers, and Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant. Umm, actually, I like ALL of their pizzas. See you soon again, CPK!

Went out to dinner Thursday night and had an AWESOME waiter.He was pleasant to talk to and consistent.  The entree that I ordered was linguini with clams.(white sauce). It was very tasty and perfect with a little parmasan cheese.The ambience was relaxing and set the mood. My waiter was friendly and made sure to accomidate me with what I needed.The Customer Service was OUTSTANDING!!!!
Good pizzas and a good selection. Soups pretty good too. Chicken waldorf salad, pesto chicken and thai chicken are my favorites.

I've never been a huge fan of CPK, but I'm becoming a big fan of their chopped salads. If you're looking for "just a salad" I would recommend only getting a half salad. I don't like their pizzas, which is a bit odd for a place called "California Pizza Kitchen." The atmosphere is very diner-esque, and the service is definitely above average. I often go here if it's on my path, but don't go out of my way to get here. One thing though: it's definitely a "Kitchen:" you can go sit at the bar and enjoy the view of all the cooks scurrying around making your dish(es). Scurry my pretties! Scurry!

CPK has Great food and a great place to dine. My favorite dish is the Chicken tequila fettuccine. The service is OK they could really improve in this area. It took a bit to get our waitress to take our order and she only came back a couple of times to check on us. But definitely highly recommend!

As far as chains go, the food is consistently pretty decent.  I had the bbq chop salad and my wife had  Chicken Milanese with arugula which we really liked.  The bread could have used some help today, but everything else is a-ok.

Typically decent fast food but we ordered 2 large Chinese chicken salads to go and when we got home it was a terrible surprise.  The lettuce was old and dry, and just ice berg( no nutrition value at all in this lettuce). For almost $12 do you think something exotic could have fallen in?.. The carrots tasted like dry roots. And the bit of purple cabbage and a spatering of noodles, does not a chicken salad make. It would have required a drive back and we had Super bowl company. Well, we were right there with the Steelers.  But what really upset us is that so very little chicken. What a shock.  I am guessing that to go food takes a back seat. to the restaurant because I have never had this type of awful salads. And we purchased two... The lettuce was like bagged lettuce and NO FLAVOR. It had nothing in common with Chinese chicken salad as I know it. No sliced almonds, small orange slices for complimentary food taste. And the dressing that tasted right out of a bottle, thick with a possible syrupy gluey texture. Awful. .  To be sure, the chopped chicken salad is still good but I won't come back for one item or we will have to stick to pizza only. .  Not sure where you all detoured in the past years but you have. We won't be back.

Went to this location once and I have no complaints. Ordered a Caramel Martini which was strong and yummy. Had some BBQ chicken salad and was not disappointed. Don't like how the other patrons had their noses in the air. It's fucking CPK for god sakes. Minus one for that.
Went here on a Saturday afternoon when it was not busy at all. I don't know why I give this place another chance. My opinion you can get better pizza and service some place else.

When did they change their bread?  At first I thought it was a fluke but the last few times I went they had this dry, boring, awful bread. I don't understand what happened. Even oil and vinegar didn't make it any better. CPK, please get better free bread.  Thank you.

Usually I have great experiences at CPK, I almost always get a pretty basic (but really good) pepperoni pizza with garlic and oregano added to it.   This particular time/location I decided to order the pita/feta/hummus appetizer, and asked if I could substitute extra hummus and feta instead of the salad that usually came with it, which I wasn't in the mood for.  My exact words were, "If they (the chefs) won't do that, just give it to me normal with the salad, no problem."  When my server brought out the plate, there was no salad and supposedly the expo "hooked it up for you" with extra hummus and feta.  Hmm, not a huge portion, but I was satisfied.  Until the bill came and he had gone into the computer and added two orders of $0.50 charges (totally $1.00, not a money issue).  I wasn't bothered by the amount, but just the unnecessary act, which would by no means help increase his tip under any circumstances.  It is certainly possible that a manager suggested the up-charge, in which case my beef is with him/her (I still tipped fairly in case that was the scenario) Just an unfortunate and unnecessary slap in the face that changed my opinion of the otherwise satisfactory experience (except for wayy to much syrup added to the flavored lemonade).
